item.title: Beehiiv’s CEO isn’t worried about newsletter saturation
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Beehiiv's co-founder and CEO Tyler Deck spoke to TechCrunch about why the company has been expanding, and where the media business is going next.

item.title: Byju’s founder to appeal U.S. court order to pay over $1B in bankruptcy case
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: A U.S. bankruptcy court has ordered Byju's founder Byju Raveendran to pay over $1.07 billion in a case over missing company funds.

item.title: Bret Taylor’s Sierra reaches $100M ARR in under two years
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: The startup’s rapid growth suggests that enerprises are embracing AI agents.

item.title: AI mania is making Nvidia a lot of money
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec, Anthony Ha, Sean O'Kane, Maggie Nye
item.description: AI companies are spending so much on infrastructure that Nvidia’s data center business now brings in nearly $50 billion. But is this sustainable growth or just the latest tech mania? And should we even be calling it a “bubble” when the belief in AI’s future is what’s holding the whole ecosystem together? This week on Equity, Kirsten Korosec, […]

item.title: Phictly’s new app brings people together over their favorite books and TV shows
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Phictly helps fans find niche clubs for their favorite books, shows, and movies, offering intimate, spoiler-safe communities with flexible pacing and tracker tools.

item.title: The European startup market is ready for the limelight
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: The region's startup market is hungry for its first trillion-dollar startup, and in many ways has set itself up to reach that goal.

item.title: Source: Kalshi’s valuation jumps to $11B after raising massive $1B round
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: The quickly growing prediction betting market raised fresh capital from Sequoia and CapitalG, according to someone familiar with the deal.

item.title: Why these founders ditched social ads for Taylor Swift concerts and prison tablets
item.dc:creator: Isabelle Johannessen
item.description: Two founders share their stories on how they approached two very different markets: teens in need of well-being advice, and formerly incarcerated individuals looking for work.

item.title: This Khosla-backed startup can track drones, trucks, and robotaxis, inch by inch
item.dc:creator: Kirsten Korosec
item.description: Point One Navigation, now valued at $230 million, is building out well beyond automotive.

item.title: Beyond growth hacks: real stories of reaching untapped markets
item.dc:creator: Isabelle Johannessen
item.description: Luna co-founder Jas Schembri-Stothart and Untapped Solutions founder Andre Peart share how they cracked go-to-market for audiences most startups avoid. In this episode of Build Mode, they reveal the guerrilla tactics, trust-building strategies, and creative experiments that helped them reach teenage girls and formerly incarcerated workers—from crashing Taylor Swift concerts to keynoting re-entry conferences.  Episodes of Build Mode drop […]

item.title: After SEC investigation, Curastory founder resigns, hires replacement
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Curastory’s founder and CEO, Tiffany Kelly, has resigned from the role and replaced herself with Dave Dickman, former CEO of the influencer marketing platform Tagger.

item.title: Cavela lands $6.6M to help brands beat pre-tariff manufacturing costs
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: The startup claims that its AI agents can reduce the cost of product manufacturing by an average of 35%.

item.title: VC Jennifer Neundorfer explains how founders can stand out in a crowded AI market
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Founders and investors alike are obsessed with AI, and even Neundorfer said her firm, January Ventures, is looking at ways to use AI to make their work more efficient, such as helping to do due diligence on the market and competition.

item.title: Legally embattled AI music startup Suno raises at $2.45B valuation on $200M revenue
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Suno has been the target of multiple AI training lawsuits but it has grown so rapidly, VCs were delighted to invest.

item.title: Subletting startup Kiki paid over $152K to settle charges after violating NYC short-term rental laws
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: Kiki Club, a subletting startup that matches listers and renters, violated NYC laws and had to pay the city over $152,000 to settle charges.

item.title: Bluesky announces moderation changes focused on better tracking, improved transparency
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: Bluesky is making moderation changes, including the addition of new reporting categories, strikes, and more clarity when communicating with users about violations.

item.title: Onepot AI raises $13M to help make chemical drug creation easier
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Onepot AI is a company that is home to the small-molecule synthesis lab POT-1.

item.title: Credit risk automation platform Kaaj raises $3.8M seed from Kindred Ventures
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Kaaj helps automate credit risk analysis so that underwriting no longer takes days, but minutes. The company announced on Wednesday a $3.8 million seed round from Kindred Ventures and Better Tomorrow Ventures.

item.title: Emm raises $9M seed to create one of the world’s first ‘smart’ menstrual cups
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: The product functions like a regular menstrual cup — designed to store period blood rather than absorb it. Emm’s medical-grade silicone is “fitted with ultra-thin, advanced sensor technology" that gathers data that will help users understand patterns about their cycles.

item.title: Astro Teller isn’t afraid of killing ideas; here’s why
item.dc:creator: Maggie Nye
item.description: TechCrunch’s editor-in-chief, Connie Loizos, sits down with Astro Teller, Captain of Moonshots at Alphabet’s X, to explore what it takes to build a factory for truly game-changing innovation. Astro reveals the three components that define a true moonshot — a huge problem, a science fiction-sounding solution, and a glimmer of breakthrough technology — and why […]
